Hahaha, oh boy. So again, to clarify....

-Flying tiger is making the KSP port.

-Flying Tiger has a strong track record of impressive....iphone games, including gems such as "Air Raid" and "Toy Raid: Elite Forces".

-The last time they made a console game was the 2004 PS2 classic "Growlanser Generations"

-Now they are learning how to work with the PS4 PS4 and Xbox1 PS4, Xbox1, AND the Wii U, all for the first time.

I was giving them the benefit of the doubt previously. I could see a rookie team learning how work with 1 system, figuring it out, and porting KSP.

But now they are doing this for 3 different and unique console architectures?

yeah OK gg.

This isnt even a PC mustard race argument, nor a "The Wii U is too weak to run it" argument.

This is you hiring the cheapest no-name devs and giving them a herculean task.

It's not like they have to write a whole engine to make it work for every console, that's the part Unity takes care of.

They "only" have to add console specific addition/changes.

This is not the same as porting a game like GTA from PS4 to PC.

Besides, what's the big problem if the PC version is unaffected by the 3 console versions?
